coref: A Lion lay asleep in the forest, A Lion great head resting on A Lion paws. A timid little Mouse came upon A Lion unexpectedly, and in A timid little Mouse fright and haste to get away, ran across A Lion's nose. Roused from A Lion nap, A Lion A Lion laid A Lion huge paw angrily on the tiny creature to kill A timid little Mouse. Spare me!, begged A timid little Mouse, Please let me go and some day I will surely repay you. A Lion A Lion was much amused to think that a Mouse could ever help A Lion. But A Lion was generous and finally let A timid little Mouse go. Some days later, while stalking A Lion prey in the forest, A Lion A Lion was caught in the toils of a hunter's net. Unable to free A Lion, A Lion filled the forest with A Lion angry roaring. A timid little Mouse knew the voice and quickly found A Lion A Lion struggling in a hunter's net. Running to one of the great ropes that bound A Lion, one of the great ropes that bound him gnawed the voice until the voice parted, and soon A Lion A Lion was free. You laughed when I said I would repay you, said A timid little Mouse. Now you see that even a Mouse can help A LionA Lion.
